item.title: Village voters say yes to streets, parks, capital improvements
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Bacon Restaurant on N. May was especially festive for a Tuesday night. Owners Cathy and Sean Cummings were hosting a watch party for a historic vote. Voters in The Village approved a permanent sales tax increase and two general obligation bond propositions Tuesday by large margins. Four of the five city council members and other […]

The post Village voters say yes to streets, parks, capital improvements appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Village residents to vote on bonds, sales tax Tuesday
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The City of The Village will have its first bond vote in history Tuesday, Jan. 9 for streets, parks and other capital improvements totaling $10.4 million to be funded by an increase in property taxes. If the vote passes, residents of The Village will still have lower municipal property taxes than their neighbors in the […]

The post Village residents to vote on bonds, sales tax Tuesday appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Rally at Capitol slams latest tax bill in Congress
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Protesters gathered at the Oklahoma Capitol Saturday to push back against the so-called “Tax Cuts and Jobs Act,” passed at 1:50 in the morning Dec. 2 in the U.S. Senate. The bill is now with a conference committee to harmonize the Senate and House versions. Both houses will have to vote on the report before […]

The post Rally at Capitol slams latest tax bill in Congress appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Local income tax for metro schools one step closer
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
OKC Councilman Ed Shadid delivered three suitcases to City Hall downtown Thursday containing what he claimed were 16,000 petition signatures for a city income tax to support local public schools. Only 12,000 are needed to put measure on the next ballot. The petition was circulated by a local organization called Save OKC Schools. It calls […]

The post Local income tax for metro schools one step closer appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC Council to decide controversial sales tax proposal
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Tuesday the City of Oklahoma City Council is set to make big decisions on what kind of sales tax proposals will be presented to city voters in September. And it looks to be a showdown between the Greater Oklahoma City Chamber of Commerce and public-school boosters on what the council will propose. The council meeting […]

The post OKC Council to decide controversial sales tax proposal appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
